intro: Pedilonum rupestre, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to rocky and arid regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or desert environments. Pedilonum rupestre is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
